definition: to whine/to be grouchy
hair/Taiwan pr. [fa3]
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
firm/sturdy/fold (for animals)/sacrifice/prison
trouble/disturbance/rumpus/flirty/coquettish/abbr. for 離騷|离骚[Li2 Sao1]/literary writings/smell of urine/foul smell/male (animal) (dialect)

sentences.english: Her long hair is often plained.
This is the third time the tourists squawked about the service of the hotel.
sentences.chinese: 这是旅客们第三次对饭店的服务发牢骚了。

sentences.english: He is forever croaking about his problems .
sentences.chinese: 他老是为他那些问题发牢骚。

sentences.english: Do you have the time, To listen to me whine.
sentences.chinese: 你有时间，来听我发牢骚吗。

sentences.english: You don’t like it here, don’t fuck so much next time.
sentences.chinese: 如果不喜欢这里，就别他妈的在这里发牢骚。

sentences.english: Go on, go on, ILove to hear you whine.
sentences.chinese: 继续说啊，我喜欢听你发牢骚。

sentences.english: I’m really bored with his sitting there doing nothing but beefing.
sentences.chinese: 他坐在那里什么事也不干，总是发牢骚，真烦死人。

sentences.english: I wish he'd stop belly-aching about his children's behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 我希望他不要再为孩子们的行为发牢骚了。

sentences.english: Just under one third said grousing was intheFrench temperament.
sentences.chinese: 近三分之一的人说法国人爱发牢骚是性情使然。

sentences.english: It is beneath him to grumble.
Online to small demon grumble, from the manager to customer scold soundly sweat.
sentences.chinese: 在线上向小妖发牢骚，从经理到客户骂得酣畅淋漓。

sentences.english: They say that some men are grouchy because they have a physical problem.
sentences.chinese: 他们发现有些人爱发牢骚是因为身体上的毛病。

sentences.english: They are beginning to murmur against new taxes.
sentences.chinese: 他们开始对新征的税发牢骚。

sentences.english: Just under one third said grousing was in the French temperament.
sentences.chinese: 近三分之一的人说法国人爱发牢骚是性情使然。

sentences.english: Some people grumble said, if regularly rising, how does let the human live?
sentences.chinese: 有人发牢骚说，要是隔三岔五的涨，让人怎么活啊？

definition: to grumble/to complain/grievance
discontent/complaint/to complain
to complain/to grumble/to harbor a complaint/to feel dissatisfied
lit. belly full of complaints (idiom)/discontent/always moaning and complaining
to complain/to grumble (about)/to reproach/to blame
to have bitter digestive fluids rising to the mouth/fig. to complain bitterly/to pour out one's sufferings
to prattle/to chatter away/to nag/garrulous/nagging
to pour out one's grievances
to catch fire/to ignite/to detonate/to get angry
long-winded/garrulous/to talk endlessly without getting to the point
to swear or curse (at people)/to scold or yell at someone
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
to seethe/to sulk/to be pissed off (vulgar)
to get angry
to shout abuses in the street
to scold/to abuse/to curse/CL:通[tong4],頓|顿[dun4]
variant of 罵|骂[ma4]
